author: AFFiNE
description: Prepare for kindergarten with our comprehensive Kindergarten Supplies Checklist. From backpacks to crayons, hand sanitizer to art supplies, this checklist covers everything young learners need for a successful school year.
md:
A Kindergarten Supplies Checklist is essential for ensuring young children have the materials they need to succeed in a school environment. Below is a comprehensive checklist to help parents gather necessary supplies for kindergarten, broken down into categories like personal supplies, classroom essentials, and optional items for extra support.


## Kindergarten Supplies Checklist


### Personal Supplies


These items are generally labeled with the child’s name for individual use.


 • Backpack: Large enough to hold folders and books.


 • Lunch Box: With a water bottle and any necessary utensils.


 • Change of Clothes: Including socks and underwear, labeled and in a resealable bag.


 • Pencil Box or Pouch: To keep personal supplies organized.


### Classroom Essentials


These items are often shared with the class and do not need to be labeled individually.


 • Pencils: Standard #2 pencils.


 • Crayons: Box of 24-count crayons.


 • Markers: Washable markers in various colors.


 • Colored Pencils: Optional, but good for projects.


 • Glue Sticks: Pack of large glue sticks.


 • Scissors: Safety scissors suitable for small hands.


 • Erasers: Large pink erasers or pencil-top erasers.


### Hygiene and Cleaning Supplies


Many classrooms request these items to help maintain cleanliness


 • Tissues: Boxes of tissues for the classroom.


 • Hand Sanitizer: Personal or classroom-sized, as needed.


 • Disinfecting Wipes: For sanitizing surfaces.


 • Paper Towels: One or two rolls.


### Art and Creative Supplies


#### These items encourage creativity and help with various art projects.


 • Construction Paper: Various colors.


 • Watercolor Paints: Simple set for art activities.


 • Play-Dough: Non-toxic for sensory and fine motor skill development.


### Optional and Extra Item


These items are sometimes suggested as helpful additions.


 • Folders: Durable folders for take-home papers.


 • Headphones: Kid-sized, for use with tablets or computers.


 • Dry Erase Markers: For individual or group activities on whiteboards.


 • Index Cards or Post-Its: For organization and notes.
title: Kindergarten Supplies Checklist
